title: Semi-local one-dimensional optical wave turbulence
authors: Cl\'ement Coll\'eaux, Jonathan Skipp, Jason Laurie, Sergey Nazarenko
abstract:
We study one-dimensional optical wave turbulence described by the 1D
Schr{\"o}dinger-Helmholtz model for nonlinear light propagation in spatially
nonlocal nonlinear optical media such as nematic liquid crystals. By exploiting
the specific structure of the nonlocal response, we derive a reduced wave
kinetic equation under a semi-local approximation that permits the study of
weak-wave turbulent cascades. We explore the realisability of the wave
turbulence predictions and demonstrate new turbulent behaviour related to
spatial nonlocality. Moreover, we show strong dependence of the wave turbulence
to the possible presence of incoherent solitonic structures.
